threats.title: Spoofing user identity
threats.description: Pretending to be something or someone other than yourself
threats.mitigation: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and account lockout on failed login attempts.

threats.title: Credential Interception via MITM Attack
threats.description: If the login page is not encrypted with HTTPS, an attacker could steal user credentials in transit.
threats.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS and use TLS 1.3 for all traffic. Add HSTS headers

threats.title: Brute Force Login Attempts
threats.description: Automated bots can continuously try logging in, potentially locking out users or crashing the server.
threats.mitigation: Add CAPTCHA, rate limiting, and lockout policies after multiple failed attempts.

threats.title: Weak Input Validation
threats.description: Malicious input (like SQL injection) could bypass login or compromise the database.
threats.mitigation: Sanitize and validate all input. Use parameterized queries.

threats.title: Transaction Tampering
threats.description: Attackers may manipulate transaction values (e.g., change $100 to $1000) in transit.
threats.mitigation: Digitally sign transaction data, and validate all amounts on the server.

threats.title: Impersonation via Session Hijacking
threats.description: If session tokens are stolen, attackers can act as users to send money.
threats.mitigation: Use secure, HttpOnly cookies and regenerate session tokens on login. Monitor for anomalies.

threats.title: Privilege Escalation Attack
threats.description: A normal user might exploit a flaw to gain admin rights and view/edit financial data.
threats.mitigation: Enforce Role-Based Access Control (RBAC). Limit access based on roles and perform access checks on the server side.

threats.title: Lack of Logging and Auditing
threats.description: Admins or attackers could perform actions without being traced if logs are not kept.
threats.mitigation: Log all admin activities and store logs securely. Use monitoring tools and alerts.

threats.title: Unauthorized Data Access
threats.description: Attackers who breach the database could access personal user information like ID, card numbers, etc.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt sensitive data at rest. Use strong DB authentication and firewall protection.

threats.title: SQL Injection Attack
threats.description: An attacker could inject malicious SQL to read, change, or delete records.
threats.mitigation: Use parameterized queries and input validation. Restrict DB permissions to the minimum needed.

threats.title: Replay Attack on Transaction
threats.description: An attacker might resend old transactions (replay) to trick the system into making payments.
threats.mitigation: Use unique transaction IDs and timestamps. Validate freshness of requests.

threats.title: Unverified External Endpoint
threats.description: Communicating with a fake payment gateway could expose sensitive financial data.
threats.mitigation: Use certificate pinning and verify endpoints using secure authentication methods.
